intro: Rumohra amabilis var. yakusimensis, commonly known as the Yakushima fern, is a rare and striking variant of the native fern species found primarily in the subtropical forests of Yakushima Island, Japan. It is characterized by its large, glossy, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 1 meter in length, often adorned with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically growing on tree trunks or among dense foliage. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its ecological significance and rarity, it is protected within its native habitat.
